climbs.name: Tainted Brownies
climbs.fa: Jonathan Gerst, Mike Reardon, Kevin Junge, March 2020

content.description: Juggy down low.  Steep and crimpy crux near finish. Based on advice from Mike Reardon not to poop in the brownie mix (i.e. make access work for everyone)!
content.location: This is the 2nd route you approach at the short wall on your descent to the main west cliff.

climbs.name: Map Master Mike
climbs.fa: Kevin Junge, Mike Reardon, Jonathan Gerst, March 2020

content.description: Juggy down low.  Steep and crimpy crux near finish.
content.location: This is the third route you approach at the short wall on your descent to the main west cliff.

content.description: The problem follows a crack running from right to left up to a ledge where you can pull yourself up onto and walk down. The Crux would be the end of the problem due to the height, but the under cling start was surprisingly comfortable. In the photos there is a green route with an alternate ending that is less precarious and easier to top (V1) and the yellow top which has the uncomfortable height (V2+). My friend named the Green top "Log", and I named the Yellow top "Club".
content.protection: If you are attempting the green top just make sure to have a crash pad, more than one is great. And if you decide to go for the higher (yellow) top I would make sure to only do that with a second person who can help protect you as you fall and make sure you don't roll off of the trail. I personally would NOT try the yellow top alone.
content.location: The pictures I include should give a good idea as to where to start and end! There are some really good natural foot holds for the start, one being near the bottom right of where the crack begins, and another farther to the left where your left foot would naturally be. your hand start with an under cling position and you just start working your way left and up!

content.description: Crux is last move.  Watch for chossy holds.
content.location: Furthest right route at the mini cliff above main West Cliff.

content.description:
You may just need a stiff toe like ole Charlie to climb this great warm-up.  Named after Charlie's unbendable toe action from a rattlesnake bite near Hogback Mtn in '72. Direct start is 5.8, or start a few feet to the right for easier terrain.

For extra cherry, pull mantle move above anchor and launch off for big clean fall!
content.protection: 2 bolts to fixed anchors. Run it out to the 1st bolt, bring a stick clip, or plug a small cam down low.
content.location: This is the first route you approach at the short wall on your descent to the main west cliff.

content.description: 5.10 crux (last move) can be skipped if you nab the anchors, otherwise 5.9.
content.protection: Nut and red or green BD cam to protect lower moves, then 3 bolts to anchors.
